intro: Stenanona zoque, commonly known as the Zoque evergreen, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
